TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed KeyboardType extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Enumerates values returned by several types.
Docs.remarks:
Enumerates value returned by the following:
.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.KeyboardType Alpha = int32(3)

summary.para: A keyboard with all the letters, and maybe some numbers.

An alphabetic keyboard supports text entry directly but may have a condensed layout with a small form factor. In contrast to a , some symbols may only be accessible using special on-screen character pickers. In addition, to improve typing speed and accuracy, the framework provides special affordances for alphabetic keyboards such as auto-capitalization and toggled / locked shift and alt keys.
This type of keyboard is generally designed for thumb typing.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.KeyboardType BuiltInKeyboard = int32(0)

summary.para: The id of the device's primary built in keyboard is always 0.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.KeyboardType Full = int32(4)

summary.para: A full keyboard behaves like a PC keyboard. All symbols are accessed directly by pressing keys on the keyboard without on-screen support or affordances such as auto-capitalization.
This type of keyboard is generally designed for full two hand typing.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.KeyboardType Numeric = int32(1)

summary.para: A numeric keyboard supports text entry using a multi-tap approach. It may be necessary to tap a key multiple times to generate the desired letter or symbol.
This type of keyboard is generally designed for thumb typing.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.KeyboardType Predictive = int32(2)

summary.para: A keyboard with all the letters, but with more than one letter per key.
This type of keyboard is generally designed for thumb typing.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.KeyboardType SpecialFunction = int32(5)

summary.para: A keyboard that is only used to control special functions rather than for typing.
A special function keyboard consists only of non-printing keys such as HOME and POWER that are not actually used for typing.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.KeyboardType VirtualKeyboard = int32(-1)

summary.para: The id of a generic virtual keyboard with a full layout that can be used to synthesize key events. Typically used with .
